description: A particularly short-lived square temple on the rocky peninsula south  of Weston-super-Mare. Lewis (1966) suggests it may have been converted for use in smelting.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Brean Down (Somerset), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Apsimon, (1965), The Roman temple on Brean Down, Somerset, Proc University of Bristol Spelaeology Society, 10(3)
ApSimon, (1959), Journal of Roman Studies, 49, pg. 129
ApSimon, (1958), Proceedings of the Spelaeological Society, 8, pg. 106 ff
ApSimon, (1958), Journal of Roman Studies, 48, pg. 146
